title: Game-Based Discussion Classes for Ethical Theory and Citizenship Development

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Course emphasizing the ability to apply ethical theories to real-life situations through game-based collaborative learning and discussion activities using digital devices

learning_goals: Students can explain major ethical theories (deontology, consequentialism, virtue ethics, etc.) by connecting them to game scenarios
Students can analyze decision-making processes by applying various ethical theories to moral dilemmas in games
Students can suggest ways to apply ethical theories to civic issues in real society through discussions with peer learners
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
